meanings.definition: To look at all parts of something carefully in order to detect some feature.
meanings.sent1: She scanned the map to find the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: The security guard scanned the crowd for any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent3: He scanned the room for his lost keys, only to find them in his pocket.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the horizon, searching for any sign of land.
meanings.sent5: The scientist scanned the microscope slide for any signs of bacteria.

meanings.sent1: The detective scanned the evidence for any clues.
meanings.sent2: She scanned the document before signing it.
meanings.sent3: He scanned the menu, trying to decide what to order.
meanings.sent4: The teacher scanned the students' work to check for errors.
meanings.sent5: The doctor scanned the X-ray to look for any fractures.

meanings.definition: To pass over quickly or lightly.
meanings.sent1: She scanned the book to get an overview of the plot.
meanings.sent2: The manager scanned the report before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: He scanned the email, missing the important attachment.
meanings.sent4: The bird scanned the field for any movement before landing.
meanings.sent5: The athlete scanned the competition before the race.
